title: Jane Furniss-Shields
text:
Jane Elizabeth Shields (née Furniss, born 23 August 1960) is a female English former <a href="Middle-distance%20running">middle</a> and <a href="long-distance%20running">long-distance runner</a>.
Athletics career.
At the <a href="IAAF%20World%20Cross%20Country%20Championships">IAAF World Cross Country Championships</a>, she won a team gold medal in 1986, team silver in 1984 and team bronze in 1982, and had a best individual placing of fifth in 1984. She also finished seventh in the <a href="3000%20metres">3000 metres</a> final at the <a href="1983%20World%20Championships%20in%20Athletics">1983 World Championships</a>, and represented Great Britain in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%201984%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%203000%20metres">3000 metres</a> at the <a href="1984%20Summer%20Olympics">1984 Los Angeles Olympics</a> and in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%201988%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%2010%2C000%20metres">10,000 metres</a> at the <a href="1988%20Summer%20Olympics">1988 Seoul Olympics</a>. She represented <a href="England%20at%20the%201986%20Commonwealth%20Games">England</a> in the 3,000 metres event, at the <a href="1986%20Commonwealth%20Games">1986 Commonwealth Games</a> in <a href="Edinburgh">Edinburgh</a>, <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>. Four years later she represented <a href="England%20at%20the%201990%20Commonwealth%20Games">England</a> in the 10,000 metres event, at the <a href="1990%20Commonwealth%20Games">1990 Commonwealth Games</a> in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>, <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>.
